SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 24th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
In the ALBERT sector our troops made progress during the night and early this morning and captured BRAY and the high ground east of it.
On the 3rd Army front north of the ANCRE our troops continue to attack and unconfirmed reports say they have captured GREVILLERS and LOUPART WOOD. In the 3 days fighting since 21st August the British have captured 14,000 prisoners and a number of guns.
On the LYS front local attacks were made by the enemy during the night north of BAILLEUL, south of LOCRE and north of KEMMEL; these were repulsed after sharp fighting.
North of the LA BASSEE CANAL in the GIVENCHY sector fighting took place this morning to our advantage.
French Front.
The French occupied the bridge-heads of EBRICOURT and EPINEY on the DIVETTE RIVER.
On the 10th French Army front fighting is continuing north west of JUVIGNY and MONTECOUVE FARM has been captured.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
The Italians have captured SASSO STEFANI, (west of the BRENTA), and have taken 36 prisoners.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
In ALBANIA the Austrians attacked on the morning of 22nd August at various points along the whole front from the ADRIATIC to the TOHORITZA RIVER. On the LOWER SEHENI the attack was checked. South of JAGODINA the Italians withdrew an advanced post with the loss of a mountain battery. North-west of BERAT the enemy made some progress at one point, but a counter-attack restored the situation. North-east of BERAT the Italians withdrew slightly from their advanced positions.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
24th August, 1918.
Issued at 12.50 p.m.
